title: How to Make a Foil Decorated Flowerpot

steps.headline: Save foil chocolate and candy wrappers whenever you can.
steps.description: Build up a supply for craft use. If you can't wait that long, foil wrappers can be purchased from stores that stock craft and candy-making supplies.

steps.headline: Prepare the wrappers.
steps.description:
Cut the colored foil into small rectangles. If you're using used wrappers, smooth out all wrinkles before using. Children can be shown how to do this and they'll find it a lot fun to do. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d9\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d9\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Prepare the container.
steps.description: If you're using a secondhand container, give it a good scrub and let it dry before use. If it's a new one, remove any stickers that might be on it from the retailer.

steps.headline: When it is dry, paint the whole flowerpot with glue, to seal it.
steps.description: Allow this dry before adding the wrappers.

steps.headline: Decide how you'd like the wrappers to go on.
steps.description:
There are a few options in terms of colors––multi-colored, two or three colors, even just a single color, etc. The color choice will depend on what you have but it is a lot of fun to use many colors. However, two tone can also look really effective, especially if it's for a seasonal decoration, such as red and green for Christmas, orange and brown for Halloween, two pastel colors for Easter, etc. For occasions such as Diwali, New Year (any culture) and birthdays, use as many colors as possible to make it appear festive. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Paint the back of the foil piece with glue.
steps.description:
Attach it to the flowerpot by pressing into place. It's best to work from bottom to top; that way you can fix up any of the more obvious gaps with neat overlaps into the top of the container. When adding each piece of foil, smooth out the foil from its center to its edges; this will remove air bubbles and ensure that it sticks on neatly. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/54\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/54\/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Continue until you've covered all the outside area of the flowerpot.
steps.description: Leave the base and inside of the container free of wrappers.

steps.headline: Allow the wrappers to dry completely.
steps.description: When dry, paint a coat of glue over the top of the whole creation. This will set it in place and protects it from scratches, scrapes and water when using the flowerpot. Allow to dry fully.

steps.headline: Use the decorative flowerpot.
steps.description: Add soil and a plant. Or add a dried flower arrangement. In fact, you can put anything you want inside the flowerpot. Then put it on display where it can be admired.

text:
Preparation Save foil chocolate and candy wrappers whenever you can. Build up a supply for craft use. If you can't wait that long, foil wrappers can be purchased from stores that stock craft and candy-making supplies. Prepare the wrappers. Cut the colored foil into small rectangles. If you're using used wrappers, smooth out all wrinkles before using. Children can be shown how to do this and they'll find it a lot fun to do. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Prepare the container. If you're using a secondhand container, give it a good scrub and let it dry before use. If it's a new one, remove any stickers that might be on it from the retailer. When it is dry, paint the whole flowerpot with glue, to seal it. Allow this dry before adding the wrappers. Creating the Foil Covered Flowerpot Decide how you'd like the wrappers to go on. There are a few options in terms of colors––multi-colored, two or three colors, even just a single color, etc. The color choice will depend on what you have but it is a lot of fun to use many colors. However, two tone can also look really effective, especially if it's for a seasonal decoration, such as red and green for Christmas, orange and brown for Halloween, two pastel colors for Easter, etc. For occasions such as Diwali, New Year (any culture) and birthdays, use as many colors as possible to make it appear festive. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Paint the back of the foil piece with glue. Attach it to the flowerpot by pressing into place. It's best to work from bottom to top; that way you can fix up any of the more obvious gaps with neat overlaps into the top of the container. When adding each piece of foil, smooth out the foil from its center to its edges; this will remove air bubbles and ensure that it sticks on neatly. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Foil-Decorated-Flowerpot-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Continue until you've covered all the outside area of the flowerpot. Leave the base and inside of the container free of wrappers. Allow the wrappers to dry completely. When dry, paint a coat of glue over the top of the whole creation. This will set it in place and protects it from scratches, scrapes and water when using the flowerpot. Allow to dry fully. Use the decorative flowerpot. Add soil and a plant. Or add a dried flower arrangement. In fact, you can put anything you want inside the flowerpot. Then put it on display where it can be admired.
